com.davidbracewell.logging

Interface Loggable

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Application
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ArrayConverter, Broker, Broker.Producer, CommandLineApplication, EnumConverter, IterableProducer, JavaFXApplication, ReflectionUtils, StreamProducer, SwingApplication

    public interface Loggable

    Defines methods for conveniently logging messages.

    Author:
    David B. Bracewell

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default void log(Level level, String message, Object... args)
      Log a message with any number of arguments at the designated log level.
      default void logFine(String message, Object... args)
      Logs a message at Level.FINE.
      default void logFine(Throwable throwable)
      Logs the stack trace for a throwable at Level.FINE.
      default void logFiner(String message, Object... args)
      Logs a message at Level.FINER.
      default void logFiner(Throwable throwable)
      Logs the stack trace for a throwable at Level.FINER.
      default void logFinest(String message, Object... args)
      Logs a message at Level.FINEST.
      default void logFinest(Throwable throwable)
      Logs the stack trace for a throwable at Level.FINEST.
      default void logInfo(String message, Object... args)
      Logs a message at Level.INFO.
      default void logInfo(Throwable throwable)
      Logs a message at Level.INFO.
      default void logSevere(String message, Object... args)
      Logs a message at Level.SEVERE.
      default void logSevere(Throwable throwable)
      Logs the stack trace for a throwable at Level.SEVERE.
      default void logWarn(String message, Object... args)
      Logs a message at Level.WARNING.
      default void logWarn(Throwable throwable)
      Logs the stack trace for a throwable at Level.WARNING.

    • Method Detail

      • log

        default void log(Level level,
                 String message,
                 Object... args)
        Log a message with any number of arguments at the designated log level.
        Parameters:
        level - the level to log at
        message - the message to log
        args - the args associated with the message

        args - The arguments for the message.
